title: McCarthy Calls Trump’s New York Indictment ‘Not a Real Case’
description: The 34 felony criminal counts brought against former President Donald Trump by the Manhattan district attorney amount to “a weak case” that is politically driven, Speaker Kevin McCarthy said Wednesday.

title: Peru’s Ex-President Loses Latest Bid to Halt Extradition From US
description: Peru’s former President Alejandro Toledo lost a last-ditch request to put on hold his extradition to his home country to face corruption charges.

title: McCarthy Says China Leaders Can’t Dictate Who US Speaker Meets
description: US House Speaker Kevin McCarthy has signaled to China that the country can’t influence who he meets with, following a Southern California get-together Wednesday with Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen.

title: McCarthy’s Message to Wall Street: You Should Worry About the US Debt Ceiling
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said Wednesday that Wall Street should be concerned about the political impasse over the US debt ceiling as the country inches closer to a possible payment default.

title: Anti-Vaccine Activist RFK Jr. Challenging Biden in 2024
description: Kennedy filed a statement of candidacy Wednesday with the Federal Election Commission.

title: Xi Jinping Launches a Charm Offensive to Repair China’s Tattered Image
description: The president’s efforts to portray the nation as “trustworthy, lovable and respectable” abroad sometimes conflict with domestic considerations.

title: Mexico’s $6 Billion Iberdrola Energy Deal Marks Warning to Foreign Firms
description: Mexico’s $6 billion purchase of natural gas plants and a wind farm from Spain’s biggest power company is a warning shot to international companies, with the government claiming victory for its nationalist energy agenda.

title: Ron DeSantis Wins First Republican Endorsement After Trump Charges
description: Representative Thomas Massie became the first congressional Republican since Donald Trump’s arraignment to formally endorse Florida Governor Ron DeSantis for president.

title: Pence Won’t Fight Order to Testify to Jan. 6 Grand Jury
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence won’t appeal a judge’s order to testify before a grand jury considering evidence in a special counsel’s probe into efforts by Donald Trump and his allies to overturn the 2020 presidential election, according to his spokesman Devin O’Malley.

title: Taiwan’s Tsai Meets Speaker McCarthy in California Despite Beijing’s Protests
description: Taiwan’s President Tsai Ing-wen arrived to meet Wednesday with House Speaker Kevin McCarthy in Southern California, providing a new challenge in the already fraught relations between Washington and Beijing.

title: Police Shutter ‘Genesis’ Dark Web Market and Arrest 119 People
description: “Operation Cookie Monster” part of law enforcement crackdown on digital crime.

title: Switzerland to Cancel, Cut Top Credit Suisse Executives’ Bonuses
description: Top Credit Suisse Group AG executives will have outstanding bonuses canceled or cut by up to half, in a step ordered by the Swiss government following the state-backed takeover by UBS Group AG.

title: US Summoned Russia’s Ambassador Over Detention of WSJ Reporter
description: The US summoned Russia’s ambassador to Washington to the State Department last week, a department spokesperson said, as the Biden administration pressures Moscow over the arrest and detention of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich on espionage charges.

title: New York City Mayor Wanted Javits Center Used as Migrant Shelter
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has tried hotels, shelters and a cruise terminal to house an influx of more than 50,000 migrants, an effort that’s stretched the budget to the breaking point and strained services.

title: Saudi Quest to Become a Nuclear Player Is Coming Up Short
description: Saudi Arabia’s efforts to break into the ranks of global uranium suppliers — and feed a nascent nuclear power program — are coming up short, with exploration investments failing to find any significant deposits of the heavy metal.

title: A Key Biden Aide Exits as Economic Team Restructures
description: Ben Harris, one of Joe Biden’s top economic aides, has left the Treasury Department, capping roughly four years with the president through his campaign, transition team and then as the Assistant Secretary for Economic Policy.

title: UK Seeks to Scare Off Migrants With Plan to House Them on Barge
description: The UK government contracted its first accommodation vessel to house asylum-seekers as Prime Minister Rishi Sunak pursues plans to cut the number of people crossing the English Channel illegally.

title: Masters Odds Suggest LIV Golfers Have Little Chance at Augusta
description: This year’s Masters will be the first time golfers from the Saudi-backed breakaway league go head-to-head against their former rivals at the sport’s best-known tournament. The odds are not in their favor.

title: Ford Sees Only Its Electric F-150 Pickup Truck Getting Full EV Tax Break — for Now
description: Ford Motor Co. expects only one electric vehicle currently in its lineup, the F-150 Lightning pickup, to qualify for a full tax credit under a new law designed to spur adoption of battery-powered models.

title: China Can’t Be Peace Mediator for Ukraine, Lithuania Says
description: China cannot act as a peace mediator over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine as Beijing’s stance would rob Kyiv of its sovereignty, according to Lithuanian Foreign Minister Gabrielius Landsbergis.

title: US-China Split Could Hinder Foreign Investment and Lower Global GDP, IMF Warns
description: Geopolitical fragmentation, driven by tensions between the US and China, risks damaging the global economy, with foreign direct investment and other capital increasingly being channeled toward aligned blocs of countries, the International Monetary Fund warns.

title: Putin Says US-Russia Ties in ‘Deep Crisis,’ Blames Washington
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said relations between the US and Russia are “experiencing a deep crisis,” as he sought to blame Washington for his invasion of neighboring Ukraine.

title: Turkey Shuts Airspace to Planes Using Iraqi Airport Over Kurdish Militant ‘Infiltration’
description: Turkey closed its airspace to planes flying to and from Sulaymaniyah International Airport in Iraq’s Kurdish region, accusing separatist militants of using the site.

title: NATO Member Finland Picks Rafael for Air Defense System
description: Finland selected Rafael Advanced Defense Systems Ltd to provide an air-defense system that will plug a hole in the weaponry of NATO’s newest member at the cost of €316 million ($346 million).

title: Mexico Inflation Eases Past Economists’ Forecast as Interest Rate Hikes Near End
description: Mexico’s headline inflation slowed more than expected in March, potentially moving the central bank closer to ending a tightening cycle that has added 725 basis points to the country’s interest rate.

title: Latvia Reintroduces Draft in Response to Russia’s War on Ukraine
description: Latvia’s parliament reintroduced compulsory military service to bolster the size of its defense forces after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Saudi Arabia Seeking Regional Embrace of Assad in Win for Iran
description: Saudi Arabia is leading efforts to formally bring Syrian President Bashar al-Assad back into the Arab inner circle as early as next month, in what would be a win for Iran and Russia and in defiance of US warnings after more than a decade of conflict.

title: Biden Trade Chief Says US Working With Allies to Counter China
description: President Joe Biden’s trade chief said the US is working with allies to counter unfair competition from China, seeking to create new agreements that bolster American supply chains and address longstanding vulnerabilities.

title: Former Italian Premier Berlusconi Hospitalized in Intensive Care
description: Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi has been hospitalized in intensive care in Milan, according to one person familiar with situation.

title: US President Biden to Travel to UK and Ireland Next Week
description: US President Joe Biden will visit Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland next week to coincide with the 25th anniversary of the signing of the Good Friday Agreement.

title: Trump Uses Felony Charges to Energize Campaign
description: Within the space of a few hours, Donald Trump underwent a transformation that left two contrasting images of the first former president in American history to face criminal prosecution.

title: Macron Says China Can Play Role in Ukraine, Rejects Decoupling
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said China can play a “major role” in Ukraine while adding that he opposes moves to decouple with the world’s second-biggest economy, as he pushes Europe to take a more moderate stance toward Beijing than the US.

title: Thaksin’s Daughter Paetongtarn Among Three Nominees of Pheu Thai Party
description: Thai opposition party leading in opinion surveys officially nominated Paetongtarn Shinawatra, a scion of the Shinawatra family, as one of its three prime minister candidates as widely expected, pitting her against ex-generals seeking to extend a near decade of military-backed rule.

title: French Unions Walk Out of Meeting as PM Stands by Pension Reform
description: French unions said they walked out of a meeting with Elisabeth Borne on Wednesday aimed at easing the conflict over plans to raise the minimum retirement age after the prime minister said the pension reform would go ahead.

title: South Africa Scraps Electricity State of Disaster After Lawsuits
description: South Africa’s government withdrew a state of disaster imposed two months ago to deal with the nation’s energy crisis after civil-rights groups filed lawsuits challenging the move.

title: Chinese Naval Surveillance Ship Docks in South African Port
description: A Chinese surveillance ship that can track rocket and spacecraft launches was docked at the eastern port of Durban this week, less than two months after South Africa drew the ire of Western nations by holding naval exercises with China and Russia.

title: Police Arrest Man in Funding Probe Into Scottish National Party
description: Police in Scotland arrested a 58-year-old man on Wednesday as a suspect in connection with an ongoing investigation into the funding and finances of the pro-independence Scottish National Party.

title: Finland’s Premier Marin to Step Down After Election Loss
description: Finland’s Prime Minister Sanna Marin will step down as the leader of her Social Democratic Party following the loss in parliamentary elections last weekend.

title: South Korea’s Yoon Set To Address Joint Session of US Congress
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is set to speak in front of a joint session of the US Congress in late April when he visits Washington, according to lawmakers familiar with the planning.

title: Eat Lamb, Not Beef, Turkish Minister Says Amid Soaring Prices
description: Turkey’s top economic official has come up with a novel suggestion to address persistent food inflation: eat more lamb.

title: South Africa Withdraws Eskom Accounting Exemption After Outcry
description: South Africa’s government withdrew an exemption granted to its beleaguered power utility from reporting irregular spending in its annual financial statements, after a public outcry against the move.

title: Iran Shoots Down Drone Near Isfahan Military Site, State TV Says
description: Iran shot down a “suspicious” drone near a military site in the central province of Isfahan, state TV reported.

title: EU Seeks to Conclude Australian Free-Trade Deal the Summer
description: The European Union is seeking to conclude a free-trade agreement with Australia by the summer, even as the two sides still need to work through some of the more contentious issues.

title: Ukraine Latest: Zelenskiy Visits Poland With Defense Deal
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy arrived in Poland, one of Ukraine’s staunchest allies, to discuss defense and economic cooperation. He will sign a deal on supplies including armored personnel carriers.

title: Taiwan Hails ‘Rare Opportunity’ to Meet McCarthy Despite Risk
description: Taiwan hailed President Tsai Ing-wen’s unprecedented meeting with House Speaker Kevin McCarthy on US soil as a “rare opportunity,” even as the move risks provoking renewed military tension around the island.

title: Israel Strikes Gaza After Rockets Fired in Fresh Escalation
description: Israeli fighter jets struck Hamas weapons manufacturing and storage sites in the central Gaza Strip early Wednesday after a barrage of rockets and mortars from Gaza were fired at southern Israel.

title: Jerusalem Mosque Stormed by Israeli Police Ahead of Passover, Ramadan
description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli police stormed into the Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem’s Old City early Wednesday, firing stun grenades at Palestinian youths who hurled firecrackers at them in a burst of violence during a sensitive holiday season. Palestinian militants in Gaza responded with rocket fire on southern Israel, prompting repeated Israeli airstrikes.

title: After 25 Years, Northern Ireland’s Youth Want More Than Just Peace
description: Those who grew up with no memory of ‘The Troubles’ fear the Good Friday Agreement is holding the region back

title: Blinken, Austin to Meet Philippine Officials in Alliance Push
description: US State Secretary Antony Blinken and Defense chief Lloyd Austin will meet their Philippine counterparts next week, as Manila vowed to pursue efforts with Washington towards “collective defense” of the region around the disputed South China Sea.

title: Trump Takes Courtroom Scowl to Campaign Stage to Reboot 2024 Bid
description: Donald Trump sat stiff and unsmiling in a New York courtroom Tuesday afternoon as he answered “not guilty” to his historic indictment. Immediately after the proceeding, he headed to the airport without uttering a word to throngs of reporters gathered outside.

title: G-7 Ministers to Seek ‘Collective’ Response to Economic Coercion
description: The flags of the G7 countries, the European Union and the 2022 G7 summit are seen behind a lectern on June 28, 2022 at Elmau Castle, southern Germany, prior to a closing press conference of the German Chancellor at the end of the G7 Summit. (Photo by KERSTIN JOENSSON / AFP) (Photo by KERSTIN JOENSSON/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Chicago Elects Business-Tax Proponent Brandon Johnson as Mayor
description: Chicago elected Brandon Johnson in the mayoral runoff, a progressive who plans to raise taxes on major corporations to boost the city’s revenue.
